    • registerBook

      public boolean registerBook(String id, String name, int pagesNumber, String review, String publicationDate, int genre, String url, double price)
      This function registers a book with its details and adds it to a list of products, sorting the list in descending order based on price.
      Parameters:
      id - A unique identifier for the book being registered.
      name - The name of the book being registered.
      pagesNumber - The number of pages in the book.
      review - A string containing a review or description of the book.
      publicationDate - The publication date of the book being registered.
      genre - The genre parameter is an integer that represents the genre of the book being registered. The switch statement in the code converts this integer value into a corresponding Genre enum value. The possible integer values and their corresponding Genre enum values are:
      url - The URL parameter is a string that represents the URL or web address of the book's cover image.
      price - The price of the book being registered.
      Returns:
      A boolean value indicating whether the book registration was successful or not.

    • registerMagazine

      public boolean registerMagazine(String id, String name, int pagesNumber, int category, String publicationDate, String publicationPeriodicity, String url, double suscriptionPrice)
      This function registers a magazine by creating a new Magazine object with the given parameters and adding it to a list of products.
      Parameters:
      id - A string representing the ID of the magazine being registered.
      name - The name of the magazine being registered.
      pagesNumber - an integer representing the number of pages in the magazine.
      category - an integer representing the category of the magazine. It can be 1 for "VARIEDADES", 2 for "DISENIO", 3 for "CIENTIFICA", or any other integer for "VARIEDADES" (default value).
      publicationDate - A string representing the date of publication of the magazine in the format "dd/mm/yyyy".
      publicationPeriodicity - The publicationPeriodicity parameter refers to how often the magazine is published, such as weekly, monthly, or quarterly.
      url - The URL is a string parameter that represents the web address of the magazine's website or online version.
      suscriptionPrice - The subscription price of the magazine.
      Returns:
      A boolean value indicating whether the magazine registration was successful or not.

    • getProductList

      public String getProductList()
      This Java function returns a formatted string containing the names of all non-null products in a list.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String that contains a list of products' names.

    • sellProduct

      public boolean sellProduct(int productOption, int userOption)
      This function sells a product to a user and updates the necessary information such as units sold and active subscriptions.
      Parameters:
      productOption - The index of the product in the products list that the user wants to sell.
      userOption - The index of the user in the ArrayList of users.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a boolean value.

    • getAllKProductInfo

      public String getAllKProductInfo()
      This function returns a string containing information about all products in a list.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String that contains information about all the products in the "products" list.

    • editProduct

      public boolean editProduct(int productOption, int categoryChange, int categoryChoice, String stringChange)
      This function edits a product's attributes based on user input and returns a boolean indicating whether the edit was successful or not.
      Parameters:
      productOption - The index of the product in the products list that needs to be edited.
      categoryChange - an integer representing the category of the product attribute to be edited (e.g. name, pages number, publication date, category, publication periodicity, price, units sold)
      categoryChoice - The choice of category for a product, represented as an integer value. The possible values are 1, 2, or 3, each corresponding to a different category.
      stringChange - A string that contains the new value to be set for the selected product's attribute.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a boolean value indicating whether the product was successfully edited or not.

    • getUserList

      public String getUserList()
      This function returns a formatted string containing a list of users' IDs and names.
      Returns:
      The method `getUserList()` returns a `String` containing a list of users with their IDs and names.

    • registerUser

      public boolean registerUser(String id, String name, String nickname, int tipeUserChoice, int categoryChoice)
      The function registers a user with their ID, name, nickname, user type, and category choice and returns a boolean indicating if the registration was successful.
      Parameters:
      id - A string representing the user's ID.
      name - The name of the user being registered.
      nickname - The nickname parameter is a String that represents the chosen username or alias for the user being registered.
      tipeUserChoice - An integer representing the type of user to be registered. 1 represents a standard user and 2 represents a premium user.
      categoryChoice - An integer representing the category choice of a Premium User. It can be 1, 2, or 3, which correspond to the categories PLATA, ORO, and DIAMANTE respectively.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a boolean value, which indicates whether the user registration was successful or not. If the registration was successful, the method returns true, otherwise it returns false.

    • editUser

      public boolean editUser(int userPosition, int categoryChange, int categoryChoice, String stringchange)
      The function edits user information such as name, nickname, and premium category choice.
      Parameters:
      userPosition - The position of the user in the ArrayList of users that needs to be edited.
      categoryChange - An integer representing the category of user information to be edited.
      categoryChoice - The category choice parameter is an integer that represents the user's choice of premium category. It is used in the editUser method to determine which premium category to assign to a user if the categoryChange parameter is set to 3 (indicating a change in premium category). The possible values for categoryChoice
      stringchange - A string representing the new value to be set for the selected category of the user.
      Returns:
      The method returns a boolean value indicating whether the user information was successfully edited or not.

    • deleteUser

      public boolean deleteUser(int userPosition)
      This Java function deletes a user from a list of users at a specified position and returns a boolean indicator of success.
      Parameters:
      userPosition - userPosition is an integer parameter that represents the position of the user to be deleted in the list of users. The position starts from 0 for the first user in the list and increments by 1 for each subsequent user.
      Returns:
      A boolean value indicating whether the user was successfully deleted or not.

    • getUserInfo

      public String getUserInfo(int option)
      This Java function returns a string containing user information based on the input option.
      Parameters:
      option - The index of the user in the "users" list whose information is to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      A string containing information about a user, based on the option parameter passed to the method.

    • getAllUserInfo

      public String getAllUserInfo()
      This function returns a string containing information about all users in a list.
      Returns:
      The method `getAllUserInfo` returns a `String` that contains information about all the users in the `users` list.

    • getProductLibrary

      public String getProductLibrary(int userOption)
      This function returns a string message containing a matrix of products sorted in descending order based on a user's option.
      Parameters:
      userOption - The index of the user in the list of users.
      Returns:
      A string message containing the product library of a user, sorted in descending order and displayed as a matrix.

    • sortListDescending

      public void sortListDescending()
      This function sorts a list of products in descending order using the compareTo method.

    • readProduct

      public String readProduct(String productOption, int userOption, int counter)
      This function reads a specific product (book or magazine) for a user and displays the current page number, along with advertisements at certain intervals.
      Parameters:
      productOption - A String representing the ID of the product that the user wants to read.
      userOption - The index of the user in the ArrayList of users.
      counter - The current page number being read by the user.
      Returns:
      A String message containing information about the product being read, including its name, the current page being read, and any advertisements that should be displayed based on the user's type and the type of product being read.

    • AddReadedPagesProduct

      public String AddReadedPagesProduct(String productOption, int userOption)
      This Java function adds one to the number of pages read for a specific product in a user's list of products.
      Parameters:
      productOption - A String representing the ID of the product that the user wants to add readed pages to.
      userOption - The index of the user in the ArrayList of users.
      Returns:
      A String message is being returned.

    • getProductFromMatrix

      public String getProductFromMatrix(int userOption, int x, int y)
      This function returns the ID of a product in a matrix based on user input and the position of the product in the user's list of products.
      Parameters:
      userOption - The index of the user in the "users" list.
      x - The x parameter represents the column number of the product in a matrix.
      y - The y parameter represents the vertical position of the product in a matrix.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String that represents the ID of a product from a matrix, based on the user option, x and y coordinates provided as parameters. If the product does not exist, the method returns a message indicating that the product does not exist.

    • totalReadPages

      public String totalReadPages()
      This Java function calculates the total number of pages read for books and magazines in a list of products.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String message that displays the total number of pages read for books and magazines in the products list.

    • sellingsByCategory

      public String sellingsByCategory()
      This function calculates the total sales for each category of magazines in a list of products.
      Returns:
      A string message with the total sales for each category of magazines.

    • sellingsByGenre

      public String sellingsByGenre()
      This function calculates the total sales of books in three different genres and returns a message with the results.
      Returns:
      A string message with the total sales for each genre of books.

    • mostReadGenreAndCategory

      public String mostReadGenreAndCategory()
      The function returns a message indicating the most read genre and category of products (books and magazines) based on the number of pages read.
      Returns:
      A String message indicating the most read genre and category, along with the number of pages read for each.
